t: Job 37
Elihu Proclaims God’s Majesty
“At*pn this also my heart trembles and*ld leaps out of its place.
Keep*ln listening to the thunder of his voice and*ld the rumbling that comes from his mouth.
Under*ln the whole heaven he lets it go, and*ld his lightning to the corners of the earth.
After*ln it his voice roars; he*ld thunders with his majestic voice, and*ld he does not restrain the lightnings when his voice is heard.
God*ln thunders wondrously with his voice; he*ld does great things that we cannot comprehend.
For*ln to the snow he says, ‘Fall on the earth,’ likewise*ld to the downpour, his mighty downpour.
He*ln seals up the hand of every man, that*ld all men whom he made may know it.
Then*ln the beasts go into their lairs, and*ld remain in their dens.
From*ln its chamber comes the whirlwind, and*ld cold from the scattering winds.
By*ln the breath of God ice is given, and*ld the broad waters are frozen fast.
He*ln loads the thick cloud with moisture; the*ld clouds scatter his lightning.
They*ln turn around and around by his guidance, to*ld accomplish all that he commands them on*ld the face of the habitable world.
Whether*ln for correction or for his land or*ld for love, he causes it to happen.
“Hear*pn this, O Job; stop*ld and consider the wondrous works of God.
Do*ln you know how God lays his command upon them and*ld causes the lightning of his cloud to shine?
Do*ln you know the balancings of the clouds, the*ld wondrous works of him who is perfect in knowledge,
you*ln whose garments are hot when*ld the earth is still because of the south wind?
Can*ln you, like him, spread out the skies, hard*ld as a cast metal mirror?
Teach*ln us what we shall say to him; we*ld cannot draw up our case because of darkness.
Shall*ln it be told him that I would speak? Did*ld a man ever wish that he would be swallowed up?
“And*pn now no one looks on the light when*ld it is bright in the skies, when*ld the wind has passed and cleared them.
Out*ln of the north comes golden splendor; God*ld is clothed with awesome majesty.
The*ln Almighty— we cannot find him; he*ld is great in power; justice*ld and abundant righteousness he will not violate.
Therefore*ln men fear him; he*ld does not regard any who are wise in their own conceit.”
